/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
kfctl build -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml made some dummy changes in kustomize/ kfctl apply -f kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.0.yaml

kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.7.0-rc.5-0-g18fba77a

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> I think this is working as intended; i.e. is not intended to regenerate the kustomize files if they have already been generated. This is by design because this would end up overwriting any changes the users had made to the kustomize files. We want users to provide a signal that the intended behavior is to overwrite the kustomize files. Rather than add an "overwrite" or "force" option the expectation is that users would just remove the kustomize directory and then run build and/or apply to take into account changes to the KFDef file. So in your case the situation would be as follows
kfctl build -f ${remote_file}, kustomize folder is created. we ask user to change local copy of ${remote_file}. For example, specify role, region, cluster name rm -rf kustomize kfctl apply -f ${local_file}
Alternatively users could do
curl -L -O http://.../kfctl_aws.yaml we ask user to change local copy of ${remote_file}. For example, specify role, region, cluster name kfctl apply -f ${local_file}
